I always find that Gwyn is the easiest boss out of all the main bosses. I guess I just don't like the fact that I can't take my time and try to fight properly with them.

I found that rolling to the side sometimes helps to get away from the grab, but I don't think I've ever outrun it. WRITING.TITLE: I hate the four kings
WRITING.TEXT:
Here are my reasons:
-the grab move is practically impossible to dodge
-that "spell" they cast at you is nearly impossible to dodge
-sometimes the two aforementioned attacks are spammed and it becomes impossible to win
-the only way to win (which is actually pretty easy if the two cheap moves aren't used) is to just run up to them and swing away with no blocking or dodging.
This fight has little to do with skill and everything to do with how the kings decide to fight you and how much damage your character can put out. If they aren't cheap, you can just run in and do as much damage as possible as fast as you can.
On my NG++ I got frustrated trying to block and dodge, getting beat over and over. So I just put my shield away, put on my Giant's armor, two-handed my zweihander +15 and just sprinted right ahead and kept swinging. Beat them on that first try. I just didn't get the feeling I got with most other bosses where I fought intelligently, timing my attacks, dodges, and blocks well and it all paid off. This boss is just a big fuck you to anyone who tries to use normal fighting tactics.
Should have checked comment history. Just a troll.

I wouldn't make bets if I were you then. I use artorias greatshield in one hand, zwei+15 in the other with black iron set. This sub is usually a great community, but I guess there's always a piece of shit like you in every sub.
60% strength scaling and 26% dex scaling for normal path. Definitely more of a strength weapon.
Zweihander weighs 10 and if you're leveling strength, zweihander +15 does a base damage of 325 and scales well with strength. Pancakes most enemies too.

WRITING.TITLE: DAE get strong, sudden feelings of emptiness and purposelessness completely for no apparent reason?
WRITING.TEXT: Edit: I mean no apparent reason as in everything seems to be fine, you're otherwise happy and nothing traumatic or bad has happened recently. You just go through a mini existential crisis while driving on the highway, feeling like there is really no meaning in anything and start wondering why you are just going through the motions. I don't mean this in a depressed or suicidal way, it's just genuinely baffling as to what existence could possibly mean and I can't seem to make sense of it.

Okay I'll agree to that point.

Your only point is that the plot wouldn't exist without the vigilantes. That is because there is no story without conflict. That's fundamental to any story. The vigilantes are antagonists because they cause problems for our main protagonist, Kenny. Kenny is the main protagonist because he is the character that the story follows. We don't see the vigilantes or know anything about them. The only interaction we have with them is the orders they give to Kenny. It might even be a stretch to call the vigilantes characters really. Might as well be a magical vending telling Kenny to do these things. Really makes no difference who is telling Kenny to do this, doesn't change the story.
When you watch CP or molest a child you are causing great harm either directly or indirectly. Not always the case with drugs and alcohol. In most cases, the person is causing harm to themselves.

From the description of the episode:
"After the virus infected his laptop, a teen faces daunting choice: carry out orders delivered by text message or risk having intimate secrets exposed."
Sounds a lot like he's the main character to me.

protagonist
prtanst,prtanst/
noun
the leading character or one of the major characters in a drama, movie, novel, or other fictional text.
the main figure or one of the most prominent figures in a real situation.
"in this colonial struggle, the main protagonists were Great Britain and France"
synonyms:chief/central/principal/main/leading character,chief/central/principal/main/leading participant,chief/central/principal/main/leading figure,chief/central/principal/main/leading player,principal,hero/heroine,leading man/lady,title role,lead
"the protagonist in the plot"
Edit: I don't see how Kenny isn't this character. Look at all the discussion about this episode. It all centers around Kenny. He's clearly the main character.
1 round...what kind of casual plays multiplayer?
But we're following Kenny through this whole thing. We don't even know who the vigilantes are. The only thing we know is that Kenny will be screwed if this video gets leaked.
I died the first time I fought pinwheel, but that's because I thought he was grave lord Nito at first. I was afraid to get close to him and attack so I ended up dying. Second time was a cakewalk.
Finished Dark Souls for the first time recently. Started NG+ but I also bought the Witcher 3 and haven't started yet...anyone here play the Witcher 3?

Being a protagonist or antagonist has absolutely nothing to do with whether or not they are the "bad guy" or "good guy." It's just the main character. The vigilantes are still the antagonist. Also, though Kenny and the others deserved punishment, what the vigilantes did would be considered cruel and unusual punishment in today's justice system. Also, by having Kenny run in and Rob a bank and giving them a really short time to drive to locations, they put innocent people's lives in danger. What if they ran someone over? What if Kenny shot someone at the bank/attacked someone?
Also, what about the other guy he was with? Yes he cheated on his wife with a prostitute, but is that really someone else's business to get involved in his marriage? Someone who doesn't even know him or his wife? Not saying his wife didn't deserve to know, but it doesn't seem to me that these people should get to see which punishment is fit.

I'll definitely agree that the episode humanized people who have sick tendencies, but Kenny still chose to masturbate to child pornography. He didn't seem to care that it was wrong until it was going to be released to the world. No, I guess being a pedophile doesn't automatically make you evil, because you could never act on it, but I'd venture to guess that there's not many pedophiles who don't act on their desires.
Kenny still had a choice even though maybe he couldn't control his attractions. We all have choices even though we may be inclined one way or another. It may be in my genetics that I'm highly prone to alcoholism or drug addiction. I can still choose not to drink or do drugs.

Yeah that's what's so great about the episode. You feel what the Kenny is feeling and you want him to get out of this situation. You root for him the whole time and then you find out he was masturbating to CP. Kind of slaps you in the face for rooting for a pedophile. I felt disgusted with myself for being so concerned about Kenny.
It was CP though. Yeah I'm sure nobody wants their porn habits shown to the world but CP isn't just "weird porn," it's completely vile and wrong.

Your best bet is to be really mean and unappreciative most of the time so when you get a gift a simple thank you will seem really grateful in comparison.

I try to be a little more outward with my gratitude/excitement when I get gifts from people I'm not as close to. Anyone who is close to me knows I don't get excited easily and I'm not very outward emotionally so a "thanks, I really like it" is fine. I'm sure if the person giving you the gift knows you well enough, they understand.
IMO it's better not to try and fake excitement or be over the top with your reaction to the gift but instead just tell them a simple thank you and that you really like the gift. Nothing worse to me than a fake, over the top reaction.

WRITING.TITLE: Just beat the game for my first time!
WRITING.TEXT:
SPOILERS AHEAD
What a phenomenal game. I will definitely be going on the try the next couple games in the series. I remember when I first started the game. I thought it was clunky and outdated and I didn't understand what to do, but I pushed on because I've heard so many good things a d I wanted to give it an honest shot. So glad I did, because this has become one of my favorite games. The only thing I regret is not doing more before defeating Gwyn. I didn't know it would all start over, otherwise I would have. Also, didn't know I had a choice in the ending, I just lit the bonfire out of habit. Oh well, guess I'll have to do that on my second time around!

Until the moment I got that last hit I couldn't breathe. Then after that I still couldn't breathe.
At what moment exactly could you breathe? You seem to be a bit delirious from a lack of oxygen! Jokes aside, that's absolutely insane. I would never go into a boss fight with one estus.
Whoops, yeah that's who I meant. Thought I put I in the description but I guess I didn't! Merry Christmas!

WRITING.TITLE: Need advice for Ornstein and Smough
WRITING.TEXT: I keep dying against them and it's really frustrating. I am summoning Solaire and I can kill one of them but I end up dying against the surviving one because Solaire dies.
